snippet: The former prime minister expressed exactly where working women stood in the 1980s: in tailored suits that were a carapace of protection in what was essentially a man’s world.
abstract: Suzy Menkes offers appraisal of fashion legacy left by Britain's former Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher, who died at age 87; notes that the tailored suits and low-heeled shoes Thatcher wore in the 1980s were both a shield and a statement about female power in a world still dominated by men.
lead_paragraph: The former prime minister expressed exactly where working women stood in the 1980s: in tailored suits that were a carapace of protection in what was essentially a man’s world.

headline.seo: For Margaret Thatcher, a Wardrobe Was Armor
headline.main: For Margaret Thatcher, a Wardrobe Was Armor
headline.print_headline: For Margaret Thatcher, A Wardrobe as Armor
